title: Кримінальний кодекс України — Статті 361–363-1 (Злочини у сфері використання електронно-обчислювальних машин)
title_en: Criminal Code of Ukraine — Articles 361–363-1 (Crimes in the Sphere of Use of Electronic Computers)
description: Chapter XVI of the Criminal Code of Ukraine governs criminal liability for cybercrimes, including unauthorised interference with information systems and networks, obstruction of access to automated systems, theft of computer information, and distribution of malicious software. These provisions implement Ukraine's obligations under the Council of Europe Budapest Convention on Cybercrime and have been updated to address modern cyberthreats, including attacks on critical information infrastructure.

provisions.title: Article 361. Unauthorised Interference with Computer Systems or Networks
provisions.content: Unauthorised interference with the operation of electronic computers, automated systems, computer networks or telecommunications networks that has led to leakage, loss, forgery, blocking of information, distortion of the processing of information or violation of the established procedure of its routing — shall be punishable by a fine of 600 to 1000 non-taxable minimum incomes of citizens, or by correctional labour for a term of up to two years, or by restriction of liberty for a term of up to three years, or by deprivation of liberty for the same term, with or without disqualification to hold certain positions or carry out certain activities for a term of up to two years. The same acts, if committed repeatedly or by prior conspiracy by a group of persons, or if they resulted in significant damage — shall be punishable by deprivation of liberty for a term of two to five years with disqualification to hold certain positions or carry out certain activities for a term of up to three years, and a fine of 1000 to 2000 non-taxable minimum incomes. Where the acts specified in paragraphs one or two of this Article were committed in conditions of martial law or caused damage to the critical information infrastructure of Ukraine — shall be punishable by deprivation of liberty for a term of five to ten years.

provisions.title: Article 361-1. Creation, Distribution or Use of Malicious Software or Hardware
provisions.content: Creation of programs or technical means intended for unauthorised interference with the operation of electronic computers, automated systems, computer networks or telecommunications networks, as well as distribution or use of such programs or technical means — shall be punishable by a fine of 500 to 1000 non-taxable minimum incomes of citizens, or by deprivation of liberty for a term of up to two years with or without disqualification to hold certain positions or carry out certain activities for a term of up to two years. The same acts committed repeatedly or by prior conspiracy by a group of persons, or if they caused significant damage — shall be punishable by deprivation of liberty for a term of two to five years with disqualification to hold certain positions or carry out certain activities for a term of up to three years. For the purposes of this Article, 'malicious software' includes computer viruses, trojans, ransomware, spyware, network worms, tools for remote unauthorised access, and any other software or code designed to disrupt, destroy, misuse or gain unauthorised access to information systems. 'Hardware' includes devices modified or specifically produced to enable unauthorised access to or interference with computer systems.

provisions.title: Article 361-2. Unauthorised Sales or Distribution of Information with Restricted Access
provisions.content: Unauthorised sales or distribution of information stored in electronic computers, automated systems, computer networks or telecommunications networks, if such information constitutes a state secret or was obtained in the course of unauthorised interference with the operation of an electronic computer, automated system, computer network or telecommunications network — shall be punishable by a fine of 500 to 1000 non-taxable minimum incomes of citizens, or by deprivation of liberty for a term of up to two years with or without disqualification to hold certain positions or carry out certain activities for a term of up to three years. The same acts committed repeatedly or by prior conspiracy by a group of persons, or if they caused significant damage — shall be punishable by deprivation of liberty for a term of two to five years with disqualification to hold certain positions or carry out certain activities for a term of up to three years. Where the acts specified in this Article involved the sale or distribution of personal data or banking information affecting a large number of persons — shall be punishable by deprivation of liberty for a term of three to seven years.

provisions.title: Article 362. Theft, Misappropriation, Extortion of Computer Information, or Its Obtaining by Deception or Abuse of Office
provisions.content: Theft, misappropriation, or extortion of computer information, or obtaining it by deception or abuse of office — shall be punishable by a fine of 50 to 200 non-taxable minimum incomes of citizens, or by correctional labour for a term of up to two years. The same acts, if committed by prior conspiracy by a group of persons, or repeated, or causing significant damage — shall be punishable by restriction of liberty for a term of up to five years, or by deprivation of liberty for the same term. The acts specified in paragraphs one or two of this Article if committed by an organised group, or if they caused damage in large amounts — shall be punishable by deprivation of liberty for a term of three to eight years. Computer information for the purposes of this Article means any information stored on an information carrier in a format suitable for processing by electronic computer systems, regardless of the nature of the information and the specific type of information carrier. The conduct of phishing operations, social engineering attacks and exploitation of system vulnerabilities to obtain computer information owned by another person shall constitute theft under this Article.

provisions.title: Article 363. Obstruction of the Lawful Operation of Automated Electronic Computers, Their Systems and Networks
provisions.content: Wilful obstruction of the lawful operation of automated electronic computers, their systems and computer networks or networks of telecommunication, committed by a person responsible for their operation — shall be punishable by a fine of 500 to 1000 non-taxable minimum incomes of citizens or by restriction of liberty for a term of up to five years, with or without disqualification to hold certain positions or carry out certain activities for a term of up to three years. The same acts, if they caused significant damage — shall be punishable by restriction of liberty for a term of two to five years, or by deprivation of liberty for the same term, with or without disqualification to hold certain positions or carry out certain activities for a term of up to three years. Where an insider employed in the critical information infrastructure of Ukraine causes obstruction resulting in a security incident with national-level consequences, the penalty shall be deprivation of liberty for a term of five to twelve years. This Article applies to persons entrusted with administering or maintaining information systems who deliberately cause system failures, introduce vulnerabilities, disable security measures, or otherwise abuse their privileged position.

provisions.title: Article 363-1. Obstruction of the Lawful Operation of Automated Electronic Computers, Systems and Networks Caused by Mass Distribution of Electronic Messages
provisions.content: Wilful mass distribution of electronic messages (spam) without consent of the recipients, in amounts that resulted in or could have resulted in the obstruction of the lawful operation of automated electronic computers, their systems or computer networks — shall be punishable by a fine of 500 to 1000 non-taxable minimum incomes of citizens, or by restriction of liberty for a term of up to three years. The same acts, if they caused significant damage — shall be punishable by restriction of liberty for a term of two to five years, or by deprivation of liberty for the same term, with or without disqualification to hold certain positions or carry out certain activities for a term of up to three years. The conduct of distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks, botnets used to send spam or conduct cyber attacks, and the supply of infrastructure used to conduct such attacks shall constitute aggravating circumstances under this Article. Where DDoS attacks are conducted against critical information infrastructure of Ukraine — shall be punishable by deprivation of liberty for a term of seven to twelve years with confiscation of property. In conditions of martial law, attacks against state communications and information infrastructure shall be treated as acts of sabotage.

provisions.title: Article 364. Notes on Application of Cybercrime Provisions
provisions.content: For the purposes of Articles 361 to 363-1 of this Code: 'significant damage' means damage caused to the state, legal entities or natural persons assessed at 100 or more non-taxable minimum incomes of citizens; 'large damage' means damage assessed at 1000 or more non-taxable minimum incomes of citizens; 'especially large damage' means damage assessed at 3000 or more non-taxable minimum incomes of citizens. International cooperation in the investigation and prosecution of cybercrimes shall be conducted in accordance with the Budapest Convention on Cybercrime and bilateral mutual legal assistance treaties. The Security Service of Ukraine and the National Police shall have joint jurisdiction over the investigation of cybercrimes, with allocation of competence determined by the subject matter of the offence: the SBU handles cybercrimes affecting national security and critical infrastructure; the National Police handles other cybercrime. Cybercrimes committed in the context of armed aggression against Ukraine or in support of terrorist activity shall be subject to enhanced penalties. Electronic evidence obtained in the investigation of cybercrimes shall be admissible in court proceedings where collected in accordance with the Code of Criminal Procedure of Ukraine.

definitions.definition: Any interference with the operation of electronic computers, automated systems, computer networks or telecommunications networks not authorised by the owner or administrator of the system, regardless of the means or method used.

Computer viruses, trojans, ransomware, spyware, network worms, tools for remote unauthorised access, and any other software or code designed to disrupt, destroy, misuse or gain unauthorised access to information systems.

Any information stored on an information carrier in a format suitable for processing by electronic computer systems, regardless of the nature of the information and the specific type of information carrier.
